verses.kjv: And after Abimelech there arose to defend Israel Tola the son of Puah, the son of Dodo, a man of Issachar; and he dwelt in Shamir in mount Ephraim.
verses.ct: After Abimelech, Tola son of Puah, son of Dodo, rose up to defend Israel. He was from the tribe of Issachar and lived in Shamir in the hill country of Ephraim.

verses.kjv: And he judged Israel twenty and three years, and died, and was buried in Shamir.
verses.ct: He led Israel for 23 years, then died and was buried in Shamir.

verses.kjv: And after him arose Jair, a Gileadite, and judged Israel twenty and two years.
verses.ct: After him, Jair from Gilead rose up and led Israel for 22 years.

verses.kjv: And he had thirty sons that rode on thirty ass colts, and they had thirty cities, which are called Havothjair unto this day, which are in the land of Gilead.
verses.ct: He had 30 sons who rode on 30 donkeys, and they controlled 30 towns in the land of Gilead that are still called Havothjair to this day.

verses.kjv: And Jair died, and was buried in Camon.
verses.ct: Jair died and was buried in Camon.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel did evil again in the sight of the LORD, and served Baalim, and Ashtaroth, and the gods of Syria, and the gods of Zidon, and the gods of Moab, and the gods of the children of Ammon, and the gods of the Philistines, and forsook the LORD, and served not him.
verses.ct: Once again the people of Israel did what was evil in the LORD's sight. They worshiped the Baalim, the Ashtaroth, the gods of Syria, the gods of Zidon, the gods of Moab, the gods of the Ammonites, and the gods of the Philistines. They abandoned the LORD and stopped serving him entirely.

verses.kjv: And the anger of the LORD was hot against Israel, and he sold them into the hands of the Philistines, and into the hands of the children of Ammon.
verses.ct: The LORD's anger burned against Israel, and he handed them over to the Philistines and the Ammonites.

verses.kjv: And that year they vexed and oppressed the children of Israel: eighteen years, all the children of Israel that were on the other side Jordan in the land of the Amorites, which is in Gilead.
verses.ct: Starting that year, they crushed and oppressed the people of Israel. For 18 years they did this to all the Israelites living across the Jordan in the land of the Amorites, which is in Gilead.

verses.kjv: Moreover the children of Ammon passed over Jordan to fight also against Judah, and against Benjamin, and against the house of Ephraim; so that Israel was sore distressed.
verses.ct: The Ammonites also crossed the Jordan to wage war against Judah, Benjamin, and the tribe of Ephraim, so that Israel was in terrible distress.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel cried unto the LORD, saying, We have sinned against thee, both because we have forsaken our God, and also served Baalim.
verses.ct: Then the people of Israel cried out to the LORD, saying, "We have sinned against you! We abandoned our God and worshiped the Baalim."

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto the children of Israel, Did not I deliver you from the Egyptians, and from the Amorites, from the children of Ammon, and from the Philistines?
verses.ct: The LORD responded to the people of Israel, "Didn't I rescue you from the Egyptians, the Amorites, the Ammonites, and the Philistines?

verses.kjv: The Zidonians also, and the Amalekites, and the Maonites, did oppress you; and ye cried to me, and I delivered you out of their hand.
verses.ct: The Zidonians, the Amalekites, and the Maonites also oppressed you, and you cried out to me, and I rescued you from their power.

verses.kjv: Yet ye have forsaken me, and served other gods: wherefore I will deliver you no more.
verses.ct: Yet you abandoned me and worshiped other gods. That is why I will not rescue you anymore.

verses.kjv: Go and cry unto the gods which ye have chosen; let them deliver you in the time of your tribulation.
verses.ct: Go cry out to the gods you have chosen! Let them rescue you in your time of trouble."

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel said unto the LORD, We have sinned: do thou unto us whatsoever seemeth good unto thee; deliver us only, we pray thee, this day.
verses.ct: But the people of Israel said to the LORD, "We have sinned. Do whatever you think is right to us, but please, just save us today."

verses.kjv: And they put away the strange gods from among them, and served the LORD: and his soul was grieved for the misery of Israel.
verses.ct: They got rid of the foreign gods among them and served the LORD, and he could no longer bear to see Israel suffering.

verses.kjv: Then the children of Ammon were gathered together, and encamped in Gilead. And the children of Israel assembled themselves together, and encamped in Mizpeh.
verses.ct: The Ammonites gathered their forces and set up camp in Gilead, while the Israelites assembled and set up camp at Mizpeh.

verses.kjv: And the people and princes of Gilead said one to another, What man is he that will begin to fight against the children of Ammon? he shall be head over all the inhabitants of Gilead.
verses.ct: The people and leaders of Gilead asked each other, "Who will be the one to launch the attack against the Ammonites? That person will become the leader of everyone living in Gilead."
